title: Kodak, Lyft, Exxon Mobil: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: U.S. stock futures edged lower as investors worried about elevated Covid-19 infection levels
body:
Here’s what we are watching as markets kick into gear Monday.
—U.S. stock futures slipped on concerns that elevated Covid-19 infection levels could weigh on economic growth through the colder months. Futures tied to the S&P 500 slid 0.3%, indicating the broader gauge could move lower after the New York opening bell. Dow futures fell 0.3%.
Read our full market wrap here.
—Business-spending management firm Coupa Software , Casey’s General Stores and collaboration-software company Smartsheet report earnings after the market closes.
—Companies including Citrix Systems , Cisco Systems and Splunk will speak at a Raymond James technology investors conference today.
